Key Match Events: Kiril Despodov scored the opening goal in the 40th minute after a loose pass by Bailey Peacock-Farrell
Aleksandar Kolev provided the assist for Despodov's goal
Northern Ireland improved in the second half but failed to equalize
Pre-Game Insights: Northern Ireland's strong run of form came to an end with a 1-0 defeat
Northern Ireland had a 4-0 win over Luxembourg in their previous match
Bulgaria were unbeaten in seven matches leading into the game
Post-Match Reflections: Northern Ireland's coach Michael O'Neill expressed disappointment with the result
Northern Ireland are now third in Group C3 after two matches
Northern Ireland will face Belarus on 12 October, while Bulgaria will play in Belfast
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at Stadion Hristo Botev with an attendance of 14,300
Northern Ireland struggled with the difficult pitch and stifling heat
Bulgaria had several chances to score, hitting the post twice in the first half
